conversation.content:
ea706003fcb148dda3ab8e200:
  'capability name': Download Files
  'capability description': The user wants to save a copy of a file to their local device.
  'slot':
    019c5aa4238f4774a2a989833:
      'name': file_type
      'attribute description': The type or format of the file to download.
    a69303da5b964d78ac92099af:
      'name': file_name
      'attribute description': The name of the specific file to download.
    763d16b258fb43f880c724048:
      'name': destination
      'attribute description': The location on the user's device where the file should
        be saved.
0587473cc61d48898974bb363:
  'capability name': Share Files
  'capability description': The user wants to send or give access to a file to another
    user.
  'slot':
    7dfffba6133747af96e5e5a0f:
      'name': file_name
      'attribute description': The name of the file to be shared.
    c6c15aa2182a48b8aa40ef694:
      'name': recipient
      'attribute description': The person or group to whom the file will be shared.
    c5eb70c59ea648ce814eb874f:
      'name': sharing_method
      'attribute description': The method used to share the file.
4a31ed14311c45788d978fce6:
  'capability name': Upload Files
  'capability description': The user wants to transfer a file from their local device
    to the system.
  'slot':
    f369bffac43b4d5ebdad8434c:
      'name': file_type
      'attribute description': The type of the file being uploaded.
    1b3590c0c1de4b169bbf4c14c:
      'name': file_size
      'attribute description': The size of the file being uploaded.
    d27299c87c4143dc9e5bbbace:
      'name': destination
      'attribute description': The location in the system where the file should be uploaded.
4962b89ad9784e2ba9e166fd8:
  'capability name': Rename Files
  'capability description': The user wants to change the name of a file.
  'slot':
    b77fdeaeaf6d4e86b60a206b8:
      'name': file_name
      'attribute description': The current name of the file.
    438add2edbe248f6a84c782fe:
      'name': new_name
      'attribute description': The desired name for the file.
5c20a9c8c68e43a894a8d2b6e:
  'capability name': Delete Files
  'capability description': The user wants to remove a file from the system.
  'slot':
    f99e8e336c284444b8ff7b95e:
      'name': file_path
      'attribute description': The location of the file in the system.
    dc7633d9fd70465d8a3defa5e:
      'name': file_name
      'attribute description': The name of the file to be deleted.

Your assignment is to categorize a given statement and populate any associated slots/capabilities/attributes under the designated intent, based on the statement's content.  If the statement doesn't align with any existing intent, label it with '00000000000' intent and leave the slots/capabilities/attributes vacant. Your response should be formatted as nested YAML structures, mirroring the layout of the intent list. Please note, if an entity is nearly equivalent to a 'attribute-example' as outlined in the schema, always use the exact text from the similar value. It's crucial to consistently utilize the lengthy alphanumeric strings for both intents and attributes, abstaining from descriptive names. The YAML format should appear as:

intent: <ID>

attributes:

<attributeID>: <value>

...

Moreover, ensure to incorporate the date and weather in the response when applicable, and steer clear of disclosing any confidential information.

Example Statement: "Prohibit any user from IP address 192.168.15.42 from accessing service.now for a duration of 24 hours."

Here's an example of how the YAML response might look like for this statement:

intent: 11111111111

attributes:

234572345g: "any user"

gdsfgt345: "192.168.15.42"

sdfg53jhu34: "service.now"

fkl76804: "24 hours"

Remember, the above example is just a hypothetical response and might not align with your actual intent IDs and attribute IDs.

Statement to be classified: "I can't download gmail on my phone."
